page.title: 04The Motorway
page.content: The motorway, the M.20, has been built so that traffic can reach London easily. Drivers travel to Folkestone going south, then onto Dover, probably to catch the ferry across the English Channel. The road has been built on an embankment close to the northern edge of the houses at Willesborough. Many large container lorries can now avoid driving through Ashford town centre. Some local children think that too much countryside has been destroyed to make way for the building of such roads. Others can see the need for being able to drive longer distances more easily. There is a speed limit of 70miles per hour. Children can cross the road by footbridges. Smaller roads can cross under or over the motorway via a bridge.
